abstract: Editorial lauds new contract between Fiat Chrysler and United Automobile Workers which raised workers' hourly pay; argues result will influence United States-based foreign manufacturers to increase their non-union workers' pay and stop slow decrease in wages; urges government to heed $30 per hour wage as new target for middle-class.
lead_paragraph: A new contract helps the efforts not only to improve pay in the auto industry, but to press for a higher minimum wage.

headline.main: Auto Workers Point the Way to Higher Pay
headline.print_headline: Auto Workers Point the Way to Higher Pay

snippet: A new contract helps the efforts not only to improve pay in the auto industry, but to press for a higher minimum wage.
